description: InterPlanetary Consensus (IPC) is a transformative blockchain architecture that enables planetary-scale performance by introducing the innovative concept of blockchains within blockchains. This pioneering approach creates infinitely scalable networks, forming dynamic tree networks of recursive blockchains, or "subnets." IPC's mission is to bridge the performance and usability gap between Web2 and Web3, powering a decentralized planetary-scale economy with unmatched speed and functionality comparable to centralized systems. For additional details, please visit: https://ipc.space/

sessions.name: Vision of Web3 Scalability with IPC - Juan Benet
sessions.description: Juan Benet, CEO of Protocol Labs, will discuss the scalability challenges faced by current decentralized systems, including blockchains, and explain why a significant increase in transaction capacity is necessary to realize the vision of Web3. The objective of Web3 is to replace centrally controlled applications with decentralized alternatives that are more user-friendly, resilient, open, and empower users to own their data and govern themselves, while providing transparency in data processing and decision-making. However, achieving this goal is currently unfeasible due to the insufficient scalability of blockchains, which lack the capacity to store data and compute power required for applications comparable to Twitter, Facebook, Figma, Gmail, and TikTok. Juan will illustrate why scalability is a crucial bottleneck for Web3 and highlight its potential to facilitate a transformative range of applications in the future.

sessions.name: IPC: Infinitely Scalable Subnets
sessions.description: Speaker: Parth Pathak, General Manager of IPC. InterPlanetary Consensus (IPC) is a transformative blockchain architecture that enables planetary-scale performance by introducing the innovative concept of blockchains within blockchains. This pioneering approach creates infinitely scalable networks, forming dynamic tree networks of recursive blockchains, or "subnets." IPC's mission is to bridge the performance and usability gap between Web2 and Web3, powering a decentralized planetary-scale economy with unmatched speed and functionality, comparable to centralized systems.

sessions.name: A closer look at the IPC Stack
sessions.description: Speaker: Raul Kripalani, CTO of IPC. In this keynote, we're going to dive into the world of IPC, exploring where it's headed and the exciting possibilities for the future. We'll cover the basic tech that IPC is built on, look at current market trends, and discuss the existing tech limits. Together, we'll imagine the new kinds of applications that could become possible with advancements in IPC and talk about the essential research required to make this vision a reality. It’s all about understanding IPC better and getting ready for the amazing opportunities that lie ahead!

sessions.name: IPC vs. other blockchain scaling solutions
sessions.description:
Speaker: Marko Vukolic, IPC Chief Scientist

In this talk, we position IPC comparing to different scaling approaches found in literature, Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other smaller ecosystems.

sessions.name: IPC M2.5: Fendermint and Canopy launch
sessions.description:
Speaker: Alfonso de la Rocha, IPC lead engineer

In this talk Alfonsio will introduce M2.5, the latest version of IPC, featuring a new Rust-written stack. He will cover enhancements in subnet management and stack security, and unveil a new testnet to assist developers in deploying applications directly to IPC, leveraging its improved capabilities.

sessions.name: Scaling Filecoin with IPC
sessions.description:
Speaker: Juan Benet, CEO of Protocol Labs.

Join Juan Bennett as he explores innovative solutions for scaling the Filecoin network. Learn how integrating IPC architecture can transform Filecoin, enabling the creation of regional subnets to significantly improve consensus times and overall performance. This talk is a must-attend for those looking to optimize their Filecoin experience and understand the future of decentralized storage.

sessions.name: Lilypad: Unlocking Powerful Distributed Compute
sessions.description:
Speaker: Allison Haire, CEO of Lilypad.

Join us to explore Lilypad, a groundbreaking "compute over data" platform, designed to transform how developers execute computational tasks. Discover how you can leverage the Lilypad network for efficient, decentralized computing. We'll also unveil two major innovations: the Incentivised Testnet and Lilypad AI Studio. Dive into a world of enhanced business opportunities, exceptional developer experience, and seamless integration with blockchain technology. Don’t miss the chance to be part of this technological leap forward!

sessions.name: Fluence: a decentralized serverless computing
sessions.description:
Speaker: Evgeny Ponomarev

In this presentation, Evgeny Ponomarev, founder of Fluence, explains Fluence and how developers can use it for decentralized computations. He describes Fluence's technical architecture and how it uses IPC (interplanetary consensus) to scale its blockchain component. Fluence is a global, secure, and scalable serverless platform and computing marketplace. Developers can build and deploy applications on Fluence, where providers compete based on price and performance to serve applications and earn rewards.

sessions.name: How Filecoin Station use IPC for retrieval checks
sessions.description:
Speaker: Patrick Woodhead

In this presentation, we will present Filecoin Station, a client application that helps users earn income by renting out their unused computational capacity. The focus of this talk is one of the Station's modules - Spark, which helps Filecoin clients to periodically check their data is retrievable from service providers. We will explain how Spark works and how it takes advantage of IPC scaling technology to improve user experience and reduce overhead costs.

sessions.name: Workshop: Deploying smart contracts on IPC
sessions.description:
Facilitator: Longfei Wang

In this workshop, we will teach the basics of smart contracts development on IPC, including deploying existing smart contracts on IPC subnet, using Mycelium Testnet, and interactions between subnets.

sessions.name: Workshop: Deploying IPC subnet, part 1
sessions.description:
Facilitators: Sarah Thiam Jia Hui

In this workshop, we will explain how to deploy IPC stack on a developer machine to get access to IPC functionality while building your application.

sessions.name: Workshop: Deploying IPC subnet, part 2
sessions.description:
Facilitators: Matt Hamilton

In this workshop, we will continue the journey of IPC deployment by creating a fully functioning subnet with multiple validators, gateways, and full nodes.

sessions.name: Workshop: Using Lilypad with IPC
sessions.description:
Facilitators: Luke Marsden

In this workshop Lilpad team will showcase their development experience: how to use the Lilypad compute network in your decentralized application to include AI inference functionality for your users.
